Articles.Content:
Hello, guys!

I've never noticed this before, so I think it's from 1.0.5: when I press the backslash key (to show KER), the game behaves like if I had right-clicked to rotate the view.

I've looked into the keybindings in Settings menu but couldn't find that keybinding.

How do I disable it?
I don't think you can. They also made it so that double right clicking causes it to do the same. Equally annoying when trying to collect science from those small experiments.

[quote name='Alshain']I don't think you can. They also made it so that double right clicking causes it to do the same. Equally annoying when trying to collect science from those small experiments.[/QUOTE]

I have to say that I really, really hate that new "mouse look" feature. It's incredibly annoying: I activate it all the time by accident, and [I][U]never[/U][/I] on purpose. Because I don't want to use it. Ever. Because it's useless. Why would I want it? If I want to rotate the view, I [I]hold the mouse button down.[/I] Does anyone actually want or use that feature?

Really wish there were a way to disable.

[quote name='Snark']I have to say that I really, really hate that new "mouse look" feature. It's incredibly annoying: I activate it all the time by accident, and [I][U]never[/U][/I] on purpose. Because I don't want to use it. Ever. Because it's useless. Why would I want it? If I want to rotate the view, I [I]hold the mouse button down.[/I] Does anyone actually want or use that feature?

Really wish there were a way to disable.[/QUOTE]
Settings->Double Click Mouse Look
You can toggle it with "Double Click Mouselook" under Gameplay in the General tab of the settings.

[quote name='FancyMouse']Settings->Double Click Mouse Look[/QUOTE]

Oh, thank heavens. And thank you, sir. (And mythbusters.)
Yeah, that mouse-look thing is not good. I thought it was a bug. Thanks for the info on turning it off.

[quote name='FancyMouse']Settings->Double Click Mouse Look[/QUOTE]

Thanks, didn't know that was there. Have some rep.
Thanks from me as well! I use backslash for staging (because the spacebar is too easy to hit accidentally), and that new behavior has been annoying.

[quote name='MaxwellsDemon']Thanks from me as well! I use backslash for staging (because the spacebar is too easy to hit accidentally), and that new behavior has been annoying.[/QUOTE]

I can't ignore this obvious xkcd reference:
[IMG]http://imgs.xkcd.com/comics/workflow.png[/IMG]
Even deactivating the mouselook double click, the mouselook kicks in when I use the "KER" key.

The new mouselook does have one use, as far as I'm concerned - no mouse on screen means no parts glowing green 'cause you left your mouse near the center when flying.

There were mods to enable this for eg videos, glad there's a stock option for this now.

I was using backslash as a secondary engine cutoff key but found the same problem as you. And, like you said, saw no sign of it in the Settings menu.


In the settings.cfg file though, the backslash key was bound to "CAMERA_MOUSE_TOGGLE" as it's primary key.
I probably won't use CAMERA_MOUSE_TOGGLE so I changed it to "None" to disable it and now my backslash does what I tell it to do.

[quote name='Warzouz']Even deactivating the mouselook double click, the mouselook kicks in when I use the "KER" key.[/QUOTE]

KER is being updated.

[quote name='Burp']In the settings.cfg file though, the backslash key was bound to "CAMERA_MOUSE_TOGGLE" as it's primary key.
I probably won't use CAMERA_MOUSE_TOGGLE so I changed it to "None" to disable it and now my backslash does what I tell it to do.[/QUOTE]

Bingo! Thanks for saying this; please have a little bit of rep.

Thanks once again, folks!

I was having this problem again on 1.1.2 and didn't remember how to fix it...
